page.title: 01HARTHILL VILLAGE
page.content: {Harthill}is a very old village in the south-eastern tip of Yorkshire. There are many types of{architecture}in the village:modern houses on Northlands, Local Authority houses on Pryor Mede, Firvale and Doctor Lane. There are also the{old village houses}mainly built on Union Street.There are two {pubs}in Harthill one is the Blue Bell and it is owned by Whitbread.There used to be a penfold behind the Blue Bell .The park was an orchard. There is a big{church}dating back to Norman times. There is also a {Methodist Chapel}on Woodall Lane. Harthill has one{school}which takes children from Harthill and Woodall. At the moment the school has 160 children aged from 5 to 11.
